channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report X-2023101088
item.description:
Report X-2023101088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: SAINT ROSE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND WITH THE TOP OF THE BOX WET, UPON INSPECTION A LOOSE CAP WAS DISCOVERED AND PLACED IN HAZMAT CAGE AND THE PROPER HAZMAT PROTOCOL PROCEDURE WAS FOLLOWED. DescribePack: THE FAILURE WAS BECAUSE OF A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE BOTTLES WHICH CAUSED LEAKAGE WHILE PACKAGE WAS BEING TRANSPORTED TO THE VANLINE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BIN TO STOP THE SPREAD OF LEAKAGE TO ANY OTHER PACKAGE NEAR IT.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package was found by PM shift personnel and placed in red Hazmat tote then placed in Hazmat holding area for AM shift personnel to process. DescribePack: Plastic bucket was cracked on bottom. Crack goes across bottom of bucket. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged packaged was found by PM shift personnel and placed in red Hazmat tote then placed in Hazmat holding area for AM shift personnel to process.

item.title: Report X-2023101068
item.description:
Report X-2023101068

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found a little wet from the bottom by the manager in unload. The package was placed in a red tote and moved to the hazmat area. DescribePack: The package was wet from the bottles caps being loose and possibly turned over. The shipper barely put any inner packing inside to protect the bottles from getting damaged. When the bottles are leaning on its side it spills out so easily. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was in red tote immediately and transported the hazmat area so QA can process properly.

item.title: Report X-2023100986
item.description:
Report X-2023100986

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The delivery driver coded package "06" Customer Refused/Damaged. Delivery driver brought package back to warehouse. Package was placed in yellow hazmat drum by PM personnel and left in QA processing area for AM personnel. The next morning package was inspected by morning shift personnel. Yellow drum was opened. Package was taken out, processed, placed in Blue Hazmat bag and placed back inside drum. DescribePack: Upon inspection discovered outer packing was wet and ripped. Discovered one gallon of coil cleaner had loose cap. 1 quart of Coil cleaner liquid leaked out into box and on all contents. The other 3 gallons of cleaner were dented. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside yellow hazmat drum and sealed by pm shift personnel to await processing the next morning.

item.title: Report X-2023100001
item.description:
Report X-2023100001

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: GEISMAR
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CANADIAN NATIONAL RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 15, 2023, CN transportation crews observed UTLX 130231 (Residue Last Contained / UN 1789 / Hydrochloric Acid / Class 8) venting from the top during a roll-by inspection inbound into Geismar yard. The railcar was isolated, all required notifications made. CN Contractor responded. Upon approaching the railcar, vapors were observed coming from the top. Upon closer inspection, puddled liquid was observed on the pressure plate. The fill hole cover bolts were checked and could be easily turned by a gloved hand. The puddled liquid was tested with ph paper and showed acidic. The fill hole cover bolts were tightened, and the leak was secured. The puddled liquid was neutralized, and the exterior of the railcar was decontaminated. The railcar was released back into transportation and allowed to continue onto destination.

item.title: Report E-2023100750
item.description:
Report E-2023100750

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 1-pint release of WD-40 from (2) 1-gallon metal cans and a 4-oz release of "WD-40" from (6) 11-oz metal cans. Only the cardboard packaging was impacted. The boxes were crushed in transit by other freight. 1) 5-gallon DM containing (2) 1-gallon Metal cans and (1) 5-gallon DM containing (6) 11-oz metal cans were overstuffed as waste and left on site for the terminal to manage. 03:10ET Louisiana Department of Public Safety was notified, report number 23-05002.

item.title: Report I-2023100038
item.description:
Report I-2023100038

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T00:34:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: New Iberia
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UTLX 648096 was involved in a derailment in New Iberia, LA due to a crossing accident. UTLX 648096 was derailed, sustained minimal damage and did not leak during the derailment. The Louisiana State Police issued an evacuation due to the hazmat in the derailment. UTLX 648096 was transloaded at a later date after the car was inspected and deemed no release occurred.
